examples.title:
Multi‑step
  wizard lets users select 50+ Google products, choose file format (JSON/MBOX),
  delivery method, schedule exports. Progress emails sent.
examples.use_case:
Large
  ecosystem providing data portability and Art. 15 access.
examples.why_selected:
Scalable,
  self‑service DSAR with granular selection and asynchronous processing.
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
User
  control & freedom; Visibility of system status

examples.title:
Auth‑gated
  portal offers “Get a copy of your data” (estimated size/time) and status
  tracker; separate flows for correct/delete.
examples.use_case:
Device +
  services vendor centralising data rights.
examples.why_selected:
Exemplifies
  transparent estimates and single login for multi‑platform data.

examples.title:
Checklist
  of categories (posts, photos, messages), date range filter, HTML/JSON format,
  “Available Files” tab for history.
examples.use_case:
Social
  network with diverse data types.
examples.why_selected:
Shows
  date‑range limiter and historical request log—good for large archives.
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
Recognition
  rather than recall; Flexibility & efficiency

examples.title:
One‑click
  “Download your data” packages activity, billing, subscriptions; email
  notification on completion.
examples.use_case:
Cloud
  & OS ecosystem fulfilling Art. 20 portability.
examples.why_selected:
Demonstrates
  simple, global export with secure link expiry.
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
Consistency
  & standards; Help users recognize, diagnose, recover
examples.error:
Page.goto: Timeout 30000ms exceeded.
Call log:
  - navigating to "https://account.microsoft.com/privacy", waiting until "domcontentloaded"

examples.title:
Request
  form in Privacy Center; shows estimated time
  (<72 h), email confirmation, and explains content of export.
examples.use_case:
Marketplace
  with identity docs & transaction data.
examples.why_selected:
Good
  example of timeframe disclosure and verification email for security.

examples.title:
Feed item
  menu option opens card listing factors (likes, follows, region) influencing
  recommendation; link to manage preferences.
examples.why_selected:
Early
  large‑scale deployment of user‑facing recommender explanation satisfying EU
  DSA transparency duties.
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
Recognition
  rather than recall; Help users recognize, diagnose, recover

examples.title:
Dropdown
  explains targeting criteria (age, interests), data source, and buttons to
  adjust ad topics.
examples.why_selected:
Pioneering
  pattern for ad‑delivery explainability with direct control links.

Simple
  micro‑explaination builds trust and encourages
  feedback loops.
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
Aesthetic
  & minimalist design; Match between system & real world

examples.title:
Under
  each job card, link shows matched skills, experience level, location; lets
  users edit profile gaps.
examples.why_selected:
Connects
  explanation with actionable profile edits, aligning incentives.
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
Help
  users recognize, diagnose, recover; Flexibility & efficiency

examples.title:
Three‑dot
  icon opens panel with source context, why result shown (language, location),
  and tips to refine query.
examples.why_selected:
Expands
  beyond ads, giving algorithm factors and credibility cues.

examples.title:
Label
  “Based on your likes” atop recommended tweet; tap … to hide similar
  tweets.
examples.why_selected:
Lightweight
  contextual cue plus direct feedback mechanism.
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
Visibility
  of system status; Recognition rather than recall
